name: huggingface_scrape_paper
description: Scrape a Hugging Face paper page. Returns title, authors, abstract, and linked models.

steps.code: const title = document.querySelector('h1')?.textContent?.trim()||''; const authorEls = document.querySelectorAll('main a[href]'); const authors = []; authorEls.forEach(a => { const href = a.getAttribute('href')||''; if (href.match(/^\/[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$/) && !href.includes('/papers') && !href.includes('/models') && !href.includes('/datasets') && !href.includes('/spaces')) { const name = a.textContent.trim(); if (name && name.length < 60 && !name.includes('\n')) authors.push(name); } }); const allPs = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('main p')); const abstract = allPs.filter(p => p.textContent.trim().length > 100).map(p => p.textContent.trim()).join(' ').substring(0, 2000) || ''; const dateEl = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('main *')).find(el => el.textContent.match(/Published on|Submitted/)); const date = dateEl?.textContent?.trim()||''; const arxiv = document.querySelector('a[href*="arxiv.org"]')?.href||''; const linkedModels = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('a[href*="/models"], a[href]:not([href*="papers"])')).filter(a => { const h = a.getAttribute('href')||''; return h.match(/^\/[^/]+\/[^/]+$/) && !h.includes('/papers/'); }).slice(0,10).map(a => a.textContent.trim()); return { title, authors: [...new Set(authors)].slice(0,20), abstract, date, arxiv_link: arxiv, linked_models: linkedModels, url: window.location.href }
